intro: Rhodamnia glabra, commonly known as the smooth rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer months. Rhodamnia glabra is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
